mapper.sql: user_id, email, submit, solved, defunct, ip, accesstime, volume, language, password, reg_time, nick, school, image, user_class, city, province, experience, introduce, birthday, sex,balance
mapper.select: select user_id, email, submit, solved, defunct, ip, accesstime, volume, language, reg_time, nick, school, image, user_class, city, province, experience, introduce, birthday, sex,balance from users where user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=BIGINT}
mapper.insert: insert into users (user_id, email, submit, solved, defunct, ip, accesstime, volume, language, password, reg_time, nick, school, image, user_class, city, province, experience, introduce, birthday, sex) values (#{userId,jdbcType=BIGINT}, #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{submit,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{solved,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{defunct,jdbcType=CHAR}, #{ip,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{accesstime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{volume,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{language,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{regTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{nick,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{school,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{image,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userClass,jdbcType=TINYINT}, #{city,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{province,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{experience,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{introduce,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{birthday,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{sex,jdbcType=TINYINT})

update users set email = #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, submit = #{submit,jdbcType=INTEGER}, solved = #{solved,jdbcType=INTEGER}, defunct = #{defunct,jdbcType=CHAR}, ip = #{ip,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, accesstime = #{accesstime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, volume = #{volume,jdbcType=INTEGER}, language = #{language,jdbcType=INTEGER}, password = #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, reg_time = #{regTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, nick = #{nick,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, school = #{school,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, image = #{image,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, user_class = #{userClass,jdbcType=TINYINT}, city = #{city,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, province = #{province,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, experience = #{experience,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, introduce = #{introduce,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, birthday = #{birthday,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, sex = #{sex,jdbcType=TINYINT} where user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=BIGINT}
mapper.select:
select a.*,IFNULL(b.count,0) as count from (select user_id, email, submit, solved, defunct, ip, accesstime, volume, language, reg_time, nick, school, image, user_class, city, province, experience, introduce, birthday, sex,balance from users where 1=1
and nick like concat('%',#{nick,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%')
and school like concat('%',#{nick,jdbcType=VARCHAR},'%')
) as a left join (select count(user_id) as count,user_id from solution GROUP BY user_id) as b on a.user_id = b.user_id ORDER BY count desc limit 50
